details.content: Australian Captain Aaron Finch won the toss and opted to bat first against India in the third and final Twenty20.
While the Indian team remains unchanged since their last game at Melbourne, the hosts replaced Jason Behrendorff with left-arm pacer Mitchell Starc.
Australia is currently leading the series with 1-0.

Team India: Rohit Sharma, Shikhar Dhawan, Lokesh Rahul, Virat Kohli (Captain), Rishabh Pant (Wicket-Keeper), Dinesh Karthik, Krunal Pandya, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Kuldeep Yadav, Khaleel Ahmed, Jasprit Bumrah
Teams Australia: D'Arcy Short, Aaron Finch (Captain), Chris Lynn, Glenn Maxwell, Marcus Stoinis, Ben McDermott, Alex Carey (Wicket-Keeper), Nathan Coulter-Nile, Mitchell Starc, Andrew Tye, Adam Zampa
Bhuvneshwar Kumar bowls the first delivery and its short and wide to D'Arcy Short, gets forward and guides it away towards thirdman. Single
D'Arcy Short hits Bhuvneshwar Kumar for a boundary in the fourth delivery.
Australia score eight runs of the first over
Khaleel Ahmed gets the ball to score the second over
Australia skipper Finch smashes Khaleel Ahmed for a four in the second ball of the over
After a bad start, Khaleel Ahmed ends the second over brilliantly with three dot balls
Bhuvneshwar Kumar bowls a good length delivery to D'Arcy Short, goes back and cuts it away straight to backward point. Boundary for the Aussies
After a bad first delivery Bhuvneshwar Kumar comes back good with four dot balls
At the end of third over Australia are 21 for no loss
India have opted for a bowling change in the fourth over
Jasprit Bumrah has been handed the ball. After bowling brilliantly in the first two T20s the pacer is expected to deliver yet again
After giving away a boundary in the first ball Bumrah comes back strongly
Bumrah dosent give much room for the batsman to score much runs as the over comes to an end with Australia 28-0 in four overs
Khaleel Ahmed is aback into the attack again
Australian batsman make good use of the pitch conditions and score two boundaries in the over
Khaleel Ahmed's over proved to be very expensive as Australia are placed at 41-0 at the end of fifth over
D Arcy hits the last ball of Bumrah's over to a boundary. Bumrah did everything right in the over except for the last ball
Eight runs come of the sixth over as the scoreboard indicates Australia at 49-0

details.title: Khaleel Ahmed runs into bowl

details.content: India desperately needs a wicket here and to do that job Kuldeep Yadav is into the attack
An amazing over from Kuldeep Yadav with just three runs coming of the over

details.title: Pulled
details.content:
Shot!

Watch via Kayo here: https://t.co/SKzJqZd9Ap #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/7Ba6QE0oL9

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 25, 2018
Another bowling change for India as Krunal Pandya is handed the ball
Rohit Sharma dropped an easy catch.
Judged the catch well but just messed it up. Krunal would be disappointed, would have been the ideal start for him.
Arcy strikes Krunal Pandya for a four in the fourth ball of the over as Australia end the eight over with home side sitting comfortably sitting at 64-0 at the end of the eighth over

details.title: Wicket!
details.content: Australia lose their first wicket as Kuldeep Yadav has Aaron Finch caught by Krunal Pandya at short fine leg.

details.title: He couldn't.
details.content:
Will Finch be able to make India pay after this dropped catch? #CloseMatters#AUSvIND @GilletteAU pic.twitter.com/ysgJyFHeQ4

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 25, 2018

details.title: Maxi in.
details.content: Glenn Maxwell comes out to bat and hits a boundary off Kuldeep to open his account.

details.title: DRS!
details.content: Maxi given out, Australia review

details.title: Not Out
details.content: Good review by Australia as the ball was leaving the leg stump.

details.title: Score
details.content:
Australia- 73/1

Overs- 9

details.title: Another review but unsuccesful
details.content: This time it's D'Arcy Short who reviews but is unsuccesful this time around. Krunal Pandya gets his first wicket in the match.

details.title: Krunal on hattrick
details.content: Krunal gets McDermott as the new man is trapped lbw. Australia in trouble here

details.title: Score
details.content:
Australia- 76/3

Overs- 10

details.title: India celebrates
Score
details.content:
Australia- 85/3

details.content:
Australia- 90/3

details.title: Maxi departs
details.content: Krunal Pandya gets his third wicket of the match as Maxwell holes out to Rohit Sharma in the deep.

details.title: Score
details.content:
Australia- 98/4,

details.title: Wide!
details.content: Khaleel Ahmed is back in the attack and starts with a wide delivery.

details.title: 100 up
details.content: Australia reach the score of 100/4 in 14.1 overs.

details.title: What a shot!
details.content: Carey lifts a Krunal delivery over extra cover for four!

details.title: Another boundary!
details.content: Carey on song as he hits successive boundaries of Krunal Pandya. This time it's a reverse sweep which goes off the bottom of the bat.

details.title: Carey gone!
details.content: Krunal gets his man after getting hit for a couple of boundaries. Caught by Kohli at deep mid-wicket

details.title: Score
details.content:
Australia- 120/5

Overs- 16

details.title: Bhuvi is back
details.content: Bhuvneshwar comes into attack to bowl the 17th.

details.title: Score
details.content:
9 from the over

Australia- 129/5

Overs- 17

details.title: Bumrah into the attack
details.content: Jasprit Bumrah is back into the attack to bowl his third over.

details.title: Wicket!
details.content: Chris Lynn is caught outside the crease as he is run-out by Jasprit Bumrah's bullet throw.

details.title: Krunal Pandya celebrates with teammates
Score
details.content:
Australia- 149/6

Overs- 19

details.title: Four!
details.content: Stoinis hits a boundary to start the final over of the innings.

details.title: Carey's shot!
Ends with a boundary
details.content: Australia finish with a score of 164/6. Hope the clouds are clear today.

details.title: The chase begins
details.content: Indian openers Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan are at the crease. Mitchell Starc to start proceedings for Australia.

details.title: Score
details.content:
Just three from the over

India- 3/0 

Overs- 1

details.title: Boundary
details.content: Rohit Sharma welcomes Nathan Coulter-Nile with a boundary.

details.title: Dhawan gets going
details.content: After playing three dot balls, Shikhar tucks one over the square leg boundary for four.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India- 12/0

Overs- 2

details.title: Wide!
details.content: First extra runs for India as Mitchell Starc bowls a wide on the off-side.

details.content:

details.title: Score
details.content:
India- 20/0

Overs- 3

details.title: Six
details.content: Dhawan muscles NCN's delivery over deep mid-wicket boundary for a maximum.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India- 40/0

Overs- 4

details.title: 20 runs from Over 4
details.content: 20 runs from Coulter-Nile's second over. Both Rohit and Shikhar hitting one maximum each.

details.title: Six off Stoinis
details.content: Rohit hits another maxium. This time is Marcus Stoinis on the receiving end as 'Hitman' pulls over mid-on boundary.

details.title: Dhawan doesn't want to fall behind
details.content: Second maximum for Dhawan as India gets to 54/0 in 4.4 overs.

details.title: Score
details.content:
22 from the over

India: 62/0

Overs- 5

details.title: DRS
details.content: Australia review for a LBW decision against Dhawan off Starc.

details.title: Out!
details.content: Australia get their first breakthrough as Dhawan is trapped LBW by Mitchell Starc

details.content:

details.title: Dot Balls!
details.content: Indian skipper Virat Kohli plays three dot balls up-front. India 67/1 after 6 overs.

details.title: Spin attack
details.content: Aaron Finch introduces leg-spinner Adam Zampa in the seventh over.

details.title: Dot Balls
details.content: India batsmen have played seven dot balls in a row.

details.title: Rohit is out
details.content: Rohit Sharma is bowled by Adam Zampa. The ball pitched on the middle and leg stump and straightened up to find the Indian opener off-guard. The LEDs light up.

details.title: Maiden wicket
details.content: That's a rare maiden-wicket bowled by Adam Zampa. India 67/2 after 7. Nine dot balls in a row.

details.title: Six!
details.content: KL Rahuls pulls Coulter-Nile over deep mid-wicket. The flies just over McDermott at the rope.

details.title: The fans are loving the chase
details.content:
The Indian fans loving this start to the run chase from Rohit and Dhawan! #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/ROW17TgQcY

— cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) November 25, 2018

details.title: Score
details.content:
India- 81/2

Overs- 9

details.title: Boundary
details.content: Kohli cuts Adam Zampa behind point for four. India are 92/2 after 10 overs.

details.content:

details.title: KL departs
details.content: KL Rahul is out as he holes out to NCN off Maxwell.

details.title: Duck for Pant
details.content: Rishabh Pant is out on the first ball. He tries to pull Andrew Tye but ends up edging it to Carey behind the stumps.

details.title: Score
details.content:
India- 109/4

Overs- 14

details.title: Virat on fire!
details.content: Kohli hits a four and six to bring India closer to the target.

details.title: 40 from 4 overs
details.content: India need 40 runs off 24 deliveries.

details.title: 27 off 18 balls.
details.content: India require 27 runs to win

details.title: Fifty for Kohli
details.content: Indian skipper Virat kohli brings up his fifty in 34 deliveries. He hit two fours and two sixes in this much-needed innings.

details.title: Six!
details.content: Dinesh Karthik hits Andrew Tye over deep square leg.

details.title: 16 off 12 balls
details.content: India inch closer to victory with 16 runs required off 12 deliveries

details.title: 5 runs needed
details.content: 5 runs required from the last over.

FIFTY! 

Here comes the 19th T20I half-century for @imVkohli. Will he see the team through to victory?#AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/udFTjYQ53m

— BCCI (@BCCI) November 25, 2018

details.title: Boundary
details.content: Kohli hits the ball straight down the ground. Just one required!

details.title: India win!
details.content: India win the match by 6 wickets and tie the series 1-1

INDIA WIN! 🇮🇳🇮🇳

Level the three match series 1-1 #AUSvIND pic.twitter.com/m5DeOC6KO2

— BCCI (@BCCI) November 25, 2018

details.title: Kohli, Krunal star in win
details.content:
